intro: Hieracium trichotulum, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm and features hairy stems and leaves. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster, with ray florets surrounding a central disk. Hieracium trichotulum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can spread aggressively through its rhizomes.
